Reviews.Title: “BELOW AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Our reservation was originally booked on Hotel Center-1. However, upon arrival we were informed that our accommodations were at Hotel Center-3, located a couple of blocks down the road. We were given directions in broken English and left to fend for ourselves in a crowded sidewalk. HC-3 is located on a side street and not easily visible. When we finally reached HC-3, nobody spoke English, and my Italian is very limited to profanity. To make matter worse, we had to wait almost an hour because housekeeping was still cleaning our room, and it was already late in the afternoon. The accommodation was extremely rudimentary, nothing spectacular as depicted on the website photos. We chose this hotel because of its central location. However, we’d definitely stay somewhere else next time. Arrivederci! TRAVEL DATES: September-2009 LOCATION: Located near the major historical sites in Rome. Hotel itself is located on a side street which is not easily visible. POSITIVE NOTES: This hotel is somewhat similar to staying at someone’s home except…. NEGATIVE NOTES: …..it definitely lacks the harmonic components due to poor customer service. AMENITIES: Free breakfast; Hairdryer, Clock/Radio; Private Bathroom. NIGHTLY RATE: $135+ Booked via Travelocity for a slightly lower rate. DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: None. NOTES: Please click the green “YES” button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Center # 3”
Reviews.Author: Varadero35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not recommended. Very noisy and staff very rude and not willing to help you in anyway. Bathroom with sliding shower door broken ( very unsafe). Recommend stay away from this hotel as much as you can. My room was the # 314.

Reviews.Title: “Complete rubbish”
Reviews.Author: 123amin
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the fairly nice looking Hotels Centre 1, we were greeted by the only fluent English speaking hotel employee of the visit. Unfortunately I was told I had to walk my luggage and daughter back up the steps and a further 5 minutes down the road, turn right to Hotels centre 3, located about halfway down Via Achille grande. Once inside the 'correct' hotel we were greeted by somebody else who spoke no English yet started asking for €16, pointing at a printed note saying an overnight accommodation tax of €2 had been introduced in January, which I had to pay before being given a key. The shower/toilet/bathroom is the smallest room I have ever walked into. There is more room in portable toilets at festivals and building sites as they don't cram basins and showers in them. The toilet seat was the wrong size and subsequently when flushed, water splashed onto the floor.  The shower had enough room to stand upright in but that was all. Movement was very restricted and the shower head itself hung on a poorly repaired handle and fell off with the slightest movement. In addition to this, the shutter/door to the shower didn't close shut so water gushed out onto the floor.  As the toilet roll holder was located right outside the shutter the paper became wet and unusable. Finally, the sink leaked so even if the toilet and shower weren't used the floor was still wet. The towels provided were of the scale as the shower and totally insufficient. Babies are wrapped in larger blankets. 'Breakfast' consisted of the cheapest, bland pastries Covered in sugar to disguise the taste.  An alternative choice of cornflakes or muesli 'style' food was on offer. I use the word 'style' as these proved even less palatable than the pastries.  Scrambled egg and cheese  were also available  but looked quite foul and were placed close to raw meat which, as a vegetarian I wouldn't eat. And the 'juicy juice' on offer was simply cordial.  Returning from a long hot day, we had to ask reception to turn on the air conditioning. And off again later. The TV remote was nowhere to be seen. I later found out they wanted money for it. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can”
Reviews.Author: Nettup
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Center 1 last time that we were in Rome, so we knew not to expect for much! The location is not graet, 7 minutes walking from the Termini station or half an hour by bus from the nearest piaaza. You can't control the aircondition by yourself (you need to ask the reception to do so for you), the breakfast is basic, and the staff sometimes pleasent and sometimes not. And yet we are Disappointed. It was poor! the toilet & the sink dripped, the noise was annoying, there was no place to put the shampoo & soap. There is a club next door & it was noisy all night. The Mattresses had better days & you can fill the Springs, there were 3 beds and it was uncomfortable to sleep together.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleymarcos1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel centre 3 in april, its based on 3 hotels all within walking distance of each other, hotel centre 1, hotel centre 2 and hotel centre 3, we got hotel centre 3 and it is defo the worst one out of the lot, the other 2 looked realy nice. The hotel is close to termini station and close to the metro aswell which is realy handy and we walked to the coliseum in 10 minutes so very central, rooms in the hotel were ok the bathroom looked like something from the 80's and i had to call reception twice to come and show us how the tv worked, aparently everytime you turn it on you have to pull the plug out of the freeview box then plug it back in, dont know if this is only are room but very strange, lots of channels though english, spanish etc. We had breakfast every morning which was nice ham, cheese,bread, chocolate cakes etc only problem is ham was allways gone when we arrived which was sometimes 30 minutes after breakfast had started and when we asked the lady she just made a funny noise and 15 minutes later appeared with another tray of ham apart from that it was all good. The neighbourhood round the hotel and termini seems to be where all the chinese and indian immigrants have settled but we felt safe and never had any problems walking round the neighbourhood at night and there are a few nice restaurants near the hotel aswell. Overall hotels in rome are expensive but for the price we paid it was ok expecially as they trow in breakfast aswell and you proberly wont get better location for ya money ether.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherryMoon13
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the bad reviews!...Yes, the neighborhood is not the best but it certainly isn't the worst either. There are places here in nyc that make this one look almost suburban. The hotel was a good price, quiet, clean, and conveniently located near the rail station which is essential is you're moving around a lot. Our window was nice and large with view of pretty flowers. About a 10 minutes walk to nearest metro station and a 10 euro cab ride away from coliseum area. We were only there for 1 night but the breakfast served was also very good. Would recommend this hotel for short term stays as opposed to long term.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Epkat
Reviews.Content: Great location in walking distance of Termini ( Metro,Bus & Shopping ) 15 Mins away.Cobble streets can be a problem with suitcases.Area between hotel and Termini a little seedy but generally OK.Room great double bed ,TV, A/C & small fridge,big bathroom with two wash hand basins,toilet & Shower (water pressure good),towels so so ( like tea towels ),bed sheets changed every day along with the towels & room well cleaned. Staff very helpful english so so but able to get by

Reviews.Title: “The worst for that price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not go there, we paid more than 120 € per night for a dark small room (bathroom was almost bigger than the room) and duveits were filthy. Breakfast was frugal: brick juice, packed buscuits and toast, tea and terrible coffee, the best in that breakfast was the hot croissants. Coffe was so bad that the lady serving it offered coffee from the coffe machine (expresso or capuccino) at a price of 1€. Staff is mean, they tried to charge us 0,50€ for a plan of Rome they voluntary offered us (we got it free later at the tourist information office). Sorroundings were absolutely terrible: prostitutes walked around the hotel whose main door is always closed (but you are opened upon ringing the bell) and surveilled by a CCTV. We had bought a tourist pack but we are sure that we could have easly got a better hotel for that crazy price. Do not let anyone to charge you so much for such a place.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBandTB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having been advised that it was close to the centre of Rome and near all the sights we wanted to explore. However, we arrived, in the pouring rain, and spent over an hour trying to find the place. We found Center 1 and a very dismissive woman told us to go around the corner. We found Center 2 to ask directions to Centre 3 and they just told us to go around the corner. Eventually we found the hotel and the man at the desk was very polite and showed us to the lift to take us to our room. The room was small and very difficult to manouver around (and we are not big people!) There was little natural light and if you opened the window (you could only open it a little) it was very noisy (trains from the station and the trams) The radio didn't work and only one bedside light. The breakfast was adequate and the lady serving was very friendly. Overall I would say if you want to be near the 'action' don't stay here but it is okay if you don't want to use your hotel during the day.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: iwas in this hotel last december... i made the booking for the center one hotel but when i arrived they move us to the center 3. This hotel is: Is closer to the *termini station* 10 minutes walking... but is not really close from the *coliseo* the street around this hotel are full of chinesse ppl and african ppl. i dindt have any problems but this is the real thing. the breakfast is normal. caffe machine and toast and butter.... the rooms are ok, mine was one for three, and they change the towels every day. nights are quiet.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Center 3
HotelInfo.Address: Via Achille Grandi 7, 00185 Rome, Italy
